member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Common.BaseUsage.MinCardinality
member.remarks: Min cardinality 0 is interpreted as optional usage, Min can not be negative. not supported in NH

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Common.BaseUsage.DefaultValue
member.summary: The actual data type of the value is defined by the DataAttribute.DataType. So developer should take care and convert this value to proper type before assigning it to parameter values

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Common.BaseUsage.IsValueOptional
member.summary: Indicates whether the value of the variable/parameter is optional.
member.remarks: Setting this propery affects the minimum cardinality.

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Common.BaseUsage.OrderNo
member.summary: Indicates the order of the usage in its context, e.g., variable order in a data structure.

member.name: T:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.AggregateFunction
member.summary: This entity lets define various processing functions that can be applied on variables. for example, temperature can be processed by Min, Max, Average, etc.

member.name: T:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.Constraint
member.summary: The base class for all concrete constraint types. It provides various attributes needed for all the constraint sub types. Among them the cultureId is a means to define different constraints on a single data attribute based on the culture.

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.Constraint.Provider
member.summary: Indicates whether the constraint is defined internally or should be populated by accessing an external provider.

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.Constraint.ConstraintSelectionPredicate
member.summary: If the constraint is defined externally, the provider is supposed to have all the information needed to access the external source in order to obtain the required constraint attributes.

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.Constraint.CultureId
member.summary: the culture the constraint applies to. i.e., a Regex to match a taxon name in German may differ from its equivalent in English, ...

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.Constraint.Description
member.summary: A free form description of the constraint

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.Constraint.Negated
member.summary: determines whether the constraint or its negation should be evaluated. e.g., the input should be evaluated for being in a range or outside of it.

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.Constraint.Context
member.summary: provides a piece of information for grouping, categorizing, or distinguishing for purposes. Like fast validation, detailed validation, validation via the UI or API, etc.

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.Constraint.MessageTemplate
member.summary: The message to be conveyed to the user in case of the constraint break.

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.Constraint.NegatedMessageTemplate
member.summary: The message to be conveyed to the user in case of the negated constraint break.

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.Constraint.DataContainer
member.summary: The the constraint applies on.

member.name: M:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.Constraint.IsSatisfied(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: The method checks whether the input satisfies the constraint. To be implemented by concrete sub-classes.
member.param: An optional data item needed by some of the constraints. In most cases not used, but in comparison

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.Constraint.FormalDescription
member.summary: The formal human readable translation of the constraint.

member.name: M:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.DomainConstraint.#ctor
member.summary: set the default message and the negated message

member.name: M:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.PatternConstraint.#ctor
member.summary: set the default message and the negated message

member.name: M:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.PatternConstraint.IsSatisfied(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: checks whether the input parameter matches the MatchingPhrase
member.param: is the input data in STRING format

member.name: T:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.RangeConstraint
member.summary: checks whether the value is inside/ outside of the specified range, not/including the boundaries. The range constraint usually applies to numeric data types, but in case of string it can be used as string length check. The data type of the provided value can be determined by the DataContainer.DataType....

member.name: M:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.RangeConstraint.#ctor
member.summary: set the default message and the negated message

member.name: T:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.ComparisonConstraint
member.summary: compares the input value to a reference/ target one using a specified comparison operator. The reference object can be an object or the value of a variable/ parameter in the same tuple

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.ComparisonConstraint.Operator
member.summary: The comparison operator, it is always a binary operator capable of comparing its left side to the right and return true or false. valid operators depend on the data type, so the UI should show proper operators based on the data attribute's data type during the constraint definition.

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.ComparisonConstraint.Target
member.summary: the target is used in the right side of the comparison operator If the target type is: Value: the target is the string representation of the value that should be compared to the input. the evaluation method should convert it to the container's data type before use. Parameter: the target shows the Id of the parameter in the current type that its value should be used in the comparison Variable: the target shows the Id of the variable in the current type that its value should be used in the comparison

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.ComparisonConstraint.OffsetType
member.summary: indicate whether the offset value is absolute or percentage in some cases the right hand side of the operator should be compared to the left having an offset. for example the project end date should be at least 100 days after its start date. Or the value of variable v1 can not be greater than 17% of the values of variable v2. Offset type can be absolute or ratio. Absolute offsets are added to the right hand side and ratios are multiplied to the right hand side before the comparison to take place

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.ComparisonConstraint.OffsetValue
member.summary: The value of the offset to be taken into account in the comparison according to

member.name: M:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.ComparisonConstraint.#ctor
member.summary: set the default message and the negated message

member.name: M:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.ComparisonConstraint.IsSatisfied(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: problem: the constraint needs the target value to compare it, if it is a variable or parameter the constraint has no clue / responsibility to access its value solution: the caller must use the TargetType and Target properties to access proper variable/ parameter and obtain their values then pass the value as auxiliary data. the function just compares data to auxiliary according to the operator

member.name: T:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.ConstraintProviderSource
member.summary: Constraints can obtain the definition of their function from their internal attributes or from an external source. In case of internal, the definition of the constraint is inside the constraint, but If it is external, the constraint is defined somewhere else like a database, and model just contains its identifier and access method. This is a good option for integration of variable values with external systems. or variables that their values changes over time

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.DataAttribute.UsagesAsVariable
member.remarks: StructuredDataStructure is the controller of this association

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.DataContainer.Self
member.summary: This is a workaround according to NHibernate's Lazy loading proxy creation! It should not be mapped!

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.DataStructure.XsdFileName
member.summary: this is used to validate xml representation of datasets, version sensitive

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.DataStructure.XslFileName
member.summary: used in UI to show the belonging datasets using proper transformation, version sensitive

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.DataStructure.Self
member.summary: This is a workaround according to NHibernate's Lazy loading proxy creation! It should not be mapped!

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.DatasetView.ContentSelectionCriterion
member.summary: to select which tuples are visible trough the view

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.DatasetView.ContainerSelectionCriterion
member.summary: to select which variables or parameters are visisble through the view

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.Dimension.Specification
member.summary: The specification in terms of LxMyTzPmEn. LMTPE are fundamental dimensions, xyzmn are +/- integer showing the power of their lefthand side dimension L(+1)M(+1,-1)T(-2) for acceleration, L0M0T+1 for time

member.name: T:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.ObtainingMethod
member.summary: Name and descroption, and etc. of methods of obtaining data like: Measurement, Observation, Processing, Simulation, Interpretation and Description

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.StructuredDataStructure.Variables
member.remarks: StructuredDataStructure is the controller of this association

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.Unit.Dimension
member.remarks: L: Length, M: Mass, A: Area, L(0)T(-1)

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.Variable.Parameters
member.remarks: DataAttribute is the controller of this association

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.DataStructure.Variable.Unit
member.summary: This is the unit directly associated with the variable. At the variable creation time, it is possible to attach the variable to the unit of its associated data container or to another unit that its dimension is equal to the dimension of the unit of the data container.
member.remarks: If the data attribute's unit changes, the validity of the variable's unit should be evaluated again.
If the variable's unit is going to be changed, the compatibility to the data container's unit's dimension should be preserved.

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Data.DatasetVersion.PriliminaryTuples
member.summary: There is a need for the tuples to be managed smarter inside any version, in order to: 1: reduce the amount of tuple duplication 2: be able to find out changes among versions e.g., deleted tuples, added tuples, changed ones 3: be able to find out what had changed in a specific version for these reasons, its better to not have the tuples loaded by the data access layer at first. PriliminaryTuples are those added or edited by this version. they may change over time

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Data.DatasetVersion.ContentDescriptors
member.summary: At least one for unstructured data

members.member: it is here for the automatic object creation by the persistence layer. Programmers SHOULD use the other constructor that takes a Dataset as a parameter

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Data.DataValue.Note
member.summary: any free note. especially in case of ObtainingMethod == Processing or Simulation, the process, formula or simulation model can be described here

member.name: T:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Data.Dataset
member.summary: The dataset points to many versions, but those versions do not have the effective complete tuples because of the design of the database. In order to have a complete version of the dataset, the DatasetManager.GetDatasetLatestVersion or GetDatasetVersion should be called.

member.name: T:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Data.AbstractTuple
member.summary: Its to overcome an inheritance issue with NH: when TupleVersion is derived from DataTuple all queries on DataTuple return versions too.

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Data.AbstractTuple.OrderNo
member.summary: indicates the order of the associated tuple in the version

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Data.AbstractTuple.XmlVariableValues
member.summary: Every variablevalue has a value, result time and also sampling time (if apply) In addition the xml node contains all associated parameter values every variablevalue knows about its Obtaining method which is one of the items in the DataAttribute ValueType

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Data.AbstractTuple.DatasetVersion
member.summary: inverse map

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Data.AbstractTuple.VariableValues
member.summary: Map from and to XmlVariableValues. Do not map to persistence data directly

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Data.AbstractTuple.Amendments
member.summary: Do not map to persistence data directly. Materialize after load

member.name: T:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Data.TupleAction
member.summary: In order to show what had happened to each tuple, a record of the action applied to them is maintained in the version they belong to.

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.MetadataStructure.MetadataPackageUsage.MetadataStructure
member.remarks: intentionally used the full name. otherwise is not shown in the class diagram.

member.name: T:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Party.PartyRelationship
member.summary: this.PartyRelationshipType.PartyTypePairs.SourcePartyType MUST CONTAIN this.SourceParty.PartyRelationshipType AND this.PartyRelationshipType.PartyTypePairs.AllowedAtrget MUST CONTAIN this.TargetParty.PartyRelationshipType

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Party.PartyRelationship.Scope
member.summary: Any restriction on the relationship not captured by the other attributes. For example: Person 1 is the coauthor of Person 2 in the scope of Paper 1

member.name: T:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Party.PartyRelationshipType
member.summary: RelationshipTypes are described from the source point of view. The sources are the higher level or the container entities. For example, A Project HIRES a person, so the relationship would be HIRES or Employs. When a consortium is created it HOLDS at least two other organizations. The type of the organizations allowed to be HOLD are determined by the PartyRelationshipType, ... PartyRelationshipType can have cardinality to restrict the number of allowed 2nd parties IN RELATIONSHIP with any given 1st party.

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Party.PartyRelationshipType.IndicatesHierarchy
member.summary: If true, the the source party type is considered to be the parent of the target party type, hence the same for the associated parties in the linked relationship

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Party.PartyRelationshipType.MinCardinality
member.summary: Minimum numbers of parties of the target type that must be asscoated to a party of the source type

member.name: P:BExIS.Dlm.Entities.Party.PartyRelationshipType.MaxCardinality
member.summary: Maximum numbers of parties of the target type that can be asscoated to a party of the source type
